au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation

Class MovingTarget3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation.MovingTarget3D

  • public class MovingTarget3D
extends Object
    Class to move a target around in 3D.

    The location can be used as the to solve FabrikChain3D / FabrikStructure3D objects.

    Version:
    0.3 - 09/01/2016
    Author:
    Al Lansley

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Pause movement of the target.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovingTarget3D

        public MovingTarget3D(Vec3f center,
                      Vec3f ranges,
                      int numSteps,
                      float depthLineHeight)
        Constructur.
        Parameters:
        center - The center point about which new waypoints are generated.
        ranges - The X/Y/Z range about which new waypoints are generated.
        numSteps - The number of steps we should use to traverse from one waypoint to the next.
        depthLineHeight - The height (on the Y-axis) of the vertical line passing through the target.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        Step from our current location to our waypoint location.

        Does nothing if the mPaused property is true.

        See Also:
        pause(), resume()

      • getCurrentLocation

        public Vec3f getCurrentLocation()
        Return the current location of this target.
        Returns:
        the current location of this target.

      • draw

        public void draw(Colour4f colour,
                 float pointSize,
                 Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw this target.
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour to draw this target.
        pointSize - The size of the point used to draw this target in pixels.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix used to draw this target.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause movement of the target.
        See Also:
        resume()

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume movement of the target after it has been paused.
        See Also:
        pause()

      • togglePause

        public void togglePause()
        Toggle the mPaused flag between false and true or vice versa.
